task_1.query_used: Search LinkedIn for Aqib Ilyas cricket professional profiles and current employment in Oman sports organizations
task_1.data:
Aqib Ilyas Sulehri, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a prominent cricketer representing the Oman national team. A right-handed top-order batsman and right-arm off-spin bowler, Ilyas has been a consistent performer since his T20 International debut against Hong Kong on November 21, 2015. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

In One Day Internationals (ODIs), Ilyas has played 32 matches, scoring 1,234 runs at an average of 44.07, including two centuries and nine fifties. His highest ODI score is an unbeaten 109. In T20 Internationals, he has accumulated 1,330 runs in 56 matches, averaging 27.70, with a top score of 90. As a bowler, he has taken 23 wickets in ODIs and 47 in T20Is. ([espncricinfo.com](https://www.espncricinfo.com/cricketers/aqib-ilyas-940593?utm_source=openai))

Ilyas made history by becoming the first Omani cricketer to score an international century, achieving an unbeaten 109 against Nepal in February 2020. He followed this with another century, scoring 105 against the United States in the same series. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

In May 2024, Ilyas was appointed captain of Oman's squad for the 2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

Regarding his current employment with Oman sports organizations, specific details are not readily available in the provided sources. For the most accurate and up-to-date information, it is recommended to consult official Oman Cricket communications or Aqib Ilyas's professional profiles on platforms like LinkedIn.

citations.title: Aqib Ilyas
Aqib Ilyas Profile - Cricket Player Oman | Stats, Records, Video
Aqib Ilyas
Aqib Ilyas

task_2.query_used: Query Oman Cricket Association official website and member directories for Aqib Ilyas
task_2.data:
Aqib Ilyas is a prominent cricketer for the Oman national team, serving as a right-handed top-order batsman and off-spin bowler. Born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, he moved to Oman at six months old and grew up in Muscat. His elder brother, Adnan Ilyas, also represented Oman in international cricket. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

Ilyas made his Twenty20 International (T20I) debut for Oman against Hong Kong on November 21, 2015. He has since been a key player, contributing significantly with both bat and ball. In May 2024, he was appointed captain of the Omani squad for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, replacing long-serving skipper Zeeshan Maqsood. ([omancricket.org](https://www.omancricket.org/ilyas-lead-oman-t20-world-cup-2024/?utm_source=openai))

Throughout his career, Ilyas has demonstrated resilience, notably overcoming a benign tumor on his ankle bone in 2021, which required an 18-month rehabilitation period. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai)) His leadership and all-round performance continue to be instrumental in Oman's cricketing achievements.

citations.title: Aqib Ilyas
Ilyas to lead Oman at T20 World Cup 2024 - Oman Cricket
Aqib Ilyas

task_3.query_used: Search Times of Oman and Oman Observer archives for news articles mentioning Aqib Ilyas cricket
task_3.data:
Aqib Ilyas has been a pivotal figure in Omani cricket, with several notable developments reported by the Times of Oman and Oman Observer:

- **Appointment as Captain for T20 World Cup 2024**: In May 2024, Aqib Ilyas was named captain of the Oman national team for the ICC Men‚Äôs T20 World Cup, replacing long-serving skipper Zeeshan Maqsood. Coach Duleep Mendis expressed confidence in Ilyas's leadership, aiming to make a significant impact in the tournament. ([cdn-2.timesofoman.com](https://cdn-2.timesofoman.com/article/145028-ilyas-to-lead-oman-at-t20-world-cup?utm_source=openai))

- **Leadership in Gulf T20I Cricket Championship**: In September 2023, Ilyas led Oman in the inaugural Gulf T20I Cricket Championship held in Qatar. The tournament featured six nations, and Ilyas's leadership was highlighted in the absence of regular captain Zeeshan Maqsood. ([timesofoman.com](https://timesofoman.com/a/136013?utm_source=openai))

- **Captaincy at Emerging Teams Asia Cup**: In July 2023, Ilyas captained the Oman A team at the ACC Emerging Teams Asia Cup in Sri Lanka. The squad included a mix of experienced players and new faces, reflecting Oman's commitment to developing emerging talent under Ilyas's guidance. ([m.timesofoman.com](https://m.timesofoman.com/article/133300-aqib-ilyas-to-lead-oman-a-at-emerging-teams-asia-cup?utm_source=openai))

These articles underscore Aqib Ilyas's significant contributions and leadership roles in advancing Omani cricket on the international stage.

citations.title: Ilyas to lead Oman at T20 World Cup - Times of Oman
Aqib Ilyas-led Oman team departs for first Gulf T20I Cricket Championship in Qatar from September 15 - Times of Oman
Aqib Ilyas to lead Oman A at Emerging Teams Asia Cup I Times of Oman - Times of Oman

task_4.query_used: Investigate ICC (International Cricket Council) player database and statistics for Aqib Ilyas
task_4.data:
Aqib Ilyas Sulehri, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a prominent cricketer representing the Oman national team. A right-handed top-order batsman and right-arm off-spin bowler, Ilyas has been a key player for Oman since his international debut in 2015. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

**One-Day International (ODI) Career:**
- **Matches Played:** 32
- **Runs Scored:** 1,234
- **Batting Average:** 44.00
- **Centuries/Half-Centuries:** 2/9
- **Highest Score:** 109*
- **Wickets Taken:** 23
- **Bowling Average:** 31.74
- **Best Bowling Figures:** 4/36

Ilyas made his ODI debut on April 27, 2019, against Namibia. Notably, he became the first Omani batsman to score an ODI century, achieving an unbeaten 109 against Nepal on February 9, 2020. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

**Twenty20 International (T20I) Career:**
- **Matches Played:** 53
- **Runs Scored:** 1,284
- **Batting Average:** 29.00
- **Half-Centuries:** 10
- **Highest Score:** 90
- **Wickets Taken:** 45
- **Bowling Average:** 15.36
- **Best Bowling Figures:** 4/10

Ilyas debuted in T20Is on November 21, 2015, against Hong Kong. He has been a consistent performer, contributing significantly with both bat and ball. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

**ICC Rankings:**
- **ODI Batting:** Ranked 59th with 507 points.
- **ODI All-Rounder:** Ranked 63rd.
- **T20I All-Rounder:** Ranked 18th. ([mykhel.com](https://www.mykhel.com/cricket/players/aqib-ilyas-p10980/?utm_source=openai))

**Personal Background:**
Ilyas moved to Oman with his family when he was six months old and grew up in Muscat. He pursued civil engineering in Dubai and was invited to train with the UAE national team but chose to represent Oman after completing his degree. In 2021, he underwent surgery to remove a benign tumor from his ankle, requiring an 18-month rehabilitation period. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

Aqib Ilyas continues to be a vital asset to Oman's cricket team, showcasing his skills as a top-order batsman and a proficient off-spin bowler.

Aqib Ilyas
Aqib Ilyas

task_5.data:
I couldn't locate specific information about companies registered under the name "Aqib Ilyas" in the Oman Ministry of Commerce's business registry. Access to such detailed records often requires direct access to the ministry's database or official channels, which may not be publicly available online.

However, I can provide information about two individuals named Aqib Ilyas:

1. **Aqib Ilyas Sulehri**: Born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, he is a cricketer who has represented the Oman national team since 2015. A right-handed top-order batsman and right-arm off-spin bowler, he has played in both One Day Internationals (ODIs) and Twenty20 Internationals (T20Is). In May 2024, he was appointed captain of Oman's squad for the 2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup. ([espn.com](https://www.espn.com/cricket/story/_/id/40062816/aqib-ilyas-takes-captain-oman-announce-t20-world-cup-squad?utm_source=openai))

2. **Aqib Ilyas**: A computer engineer with interests in algorithm design, software development, web technologies, and artificial intelligence/machine learning. He is active in open-source communities and has authored articles on topics like object-oriented programming in JavaScript and dynamic programming. ([medium.com](https://medium.com/%40aqib-ilyas?utm_source=openai))

task_6.query_used: Query ESPNCricinfo and Cricbuzz for match records and player profiles of Aqib Ilyas
task_6.data:
Aqib Ilyas Sulehri, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a prominent cricketer representing the Oman national team. A right-handed top-order batsman and right-arm off-spin bowler, Ilyas has been a key player for Oman since his debut.

**International Career:**

- **T20 International (T20I) Debut:** November 21, 2015, against Hong Kong.
- **One Day International (ODI) Debut:** April 27, 2019, against Namibia.

**Career Highlights:**

- **ODI Performance:** In 32 matches, Ilyas has scored 1,234 runs at an average of 44.07, including two centuries and nine half-centuries. His highest score is an unbeaten 109. ([espncricinfo.com](https://www.espncricinfo.com/cricketers/aqib-ilyas-940593?utm_source=openai))
- **T20I Performance:** Over 56 matches, he has accumulated 1,330 runs with an average of 27.70, achieving ten half-centuries and a top score of 90. ([espncricinfo.com](https://www.espncricinfo.com/cricketers/aqib-ilyas-940593?utm_source=openai))
- **Bowling:** Ilyas has taken 23 wickets in ODIs with a best figure of 4/36, and 47 wickets in T20Is with a best of 4/10. ([espncricinfo.com](https://www.espncricinfo.com/cricketers/aqib-ilyas-940593?utm_source=openai))

**Notable Achievements:**

- Ilyas was the leading run-scorer for Oman in the 2018 Asia Cup Qualifier, amassing 186 runs in five matches. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))
- He scored Oman's first-ever ODI century on February 9, 2020, with an unbeaten 109 against Nepal. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

**Personal Background:**

Ilyas moved to Oman with his family when he was six months old and grew up in Muscat. He pursued civil engineering studies in Dubai before returning to Oman to focus on his cricket career. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

Aqib Ilyas continues to be a vital asset to the Oman cricket team, contributing significantly with both bat and ball.

task_8.data:
Aqib Ilyas, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a prominent cricketer representing the Oman national team. He is a right-handed top-order batsman and off-spin bowler. Ilyas made his Twenty20 International debut for Oman against Hong Kong on November 21, 2015. In April 2019, he debuted in One Day Internationals (ODIs) against Namibia. Notably, he became the first Omani player to score an ODI century, achieving an unbeaten 109 against Nepal in February 2020. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

In May 2024, Ilyas was appointed captain of Oman's squad for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup. Expressing his honor, he stated, "It's a huge responsibility, and I aim to lead the team to many victories." ([espncricinfo.com](https://www.espncricinfo.com/story/aqib-ilyas-takes-over-as-captain-as-oman-announce-t20-world-cup-squad-1431787?utm_source=openai))

task_9.query_used: Search Gulf News and Khaleej Times sports sections for coverage of Aqib Ilyas cricket career
task_9.data:
I couldn't locate specific coverage of Aqib Ilyas's cricket career in the sports sections of Gulf News or Khaleej Times. However, several other reputable sources provide detailed insights into his journey.

Aqib Ilyas, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, moved to Oman as an infant. He debuted for the Oman national cricket team in 2015 and has since been a pivotal all-rounder, contributing significantly with both bat and ball. In February 2020, during the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup League 2, Ilyas showcased his prowess by scoring an unbeaten 109 runs and taking four wickets against Nepal, leading Oman to a decisive victory. ([thenationalnews.com](https://www.thenationalnews.com/sport/cricket/oman-all-rounder-aqib-ilyas-dashes-nepal-s-hopes-even-as-local-fans-win-his-heart-1.976423?utm_source=openai))

In 2021, Ilyas faced a significant health challenge when a tumor was discovered in his left ankle. The subsequent surgery sidelined him from cricket for 18 months. Demonstrating resilience, he returned to the sport and, in May 2024, was appointed captain of the Oman national team. ([indianexpress.com](https://indianexpress.com/article/sports/cricket/aqib-ilyas-story-a-cancer-survivor-who-almost-lost-his-leg-missed-cricket-for-18-months-and-is-now-omans-captain-9367450/?utm_source=openai))

Under his leadership, Oman clinched the inaugural Gulf T20I Cricket Championship in September 2023, defeating the UAE in a thrilling final. Ilyas emerged as the tournament's second-highest run-scorer, amassing 205 runs in five innings. ([timesofoman.com](https://timesofoman.com/article/136470-gulf-t20i-title-will-be-remembered-for-long-mendis?utm_source=openai))

Ilyas's journey from overcoming health adversities to leading his team to significant victories underscores his dedication and resilience in the world of cricket.

citations.title: Oman all-rounder Aqib Ilyas dashes Nepal's hopes even as local fans win his heart | The National
Aqib Ilyas story: A cancer survivor, who almost lost his leg, missed cricket for 18 months and is now Oman‚Äôs captain | Cricket News - The Indian Express
Gulf T20I title will be remembered for long: Mendis - Times of Oman

task_10.query_used: Query Oman Olympic Committee and sports federation websites for athlete registration records of Aqib Ilyas
task_10.data:
Aqib Ilyas Sulehri, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a prominent cricketer representing Oman. He is a right-handed top-order batsman and off-spin bowler. Ilyas made his Twenty20 International (T20I) debut for Oman against Hong Kong on November 21, 2015, and his One Day International (ODI) debut against Namibia on April 27, 2019. In May 2024, he was appointed as the captain of Oman's squad for the 2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

In 2021, Ilyas faced a significant health challenge when he discovered a tumor on his ankle bone. The tumor was surgically removed and confirmed as benign, but the recovery process required an 18-month rehabilitation period. He returned to competitive cricket in 2023, scoring a half-century against Ireland in the ODI World Cup qualifier. ([indianexpress.com](https://indianexpress.com/article/sports/cricket/aqib-ilyas-story-a-cancer-survivor-who-almost-lost-his-leg-missed-cricket-for-18-months-and-is-now-omans-captain-9367450/?utm_source=openai))

As of June 2025, specific athlete registration records for Aqib Ilyas are not publicly available on the Oman Olympic Committee's official website or other sports federation platforms. However, his cricketing career and achievements are well-documented through various reputable sources.

Aqib Ilyas story: A cancer survivor, who almost lost his leg, missed cricket for 18 months and is now Oman‚Äôs captain | Cricket News - The Indian Express

task_11.query_used: Search property ownership records in Oman real estate databases for assets under Aqib Ilyas
task_11.data:
Aqib Ilyas Sulehri, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a prominent cricketer who has represented the Oman national team since 2015. He is a right-handed top-order batsman and off-spin bowler. His brother, Adnan Ilyas, has also played international cricket for Oman. The Ilyas family relocated to Oman when Aqib was six months old, and he grew up in Muscat. In 2010, he moved to Dubai to pursue a degree in civil engineering. After completing his studies, he returned to Oman to focus on his cricket career. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

In Oman, property ownership is documented through a title deed known as "Mulkiya," maintained by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Planning. This document provides details about the property, including descriptions, ownership status, and any encumbrances. ([omanlawblog.curtis.com](https://omanlawblog.curtis.com/2009/02/?utm_source=openai))

To verify property ownership, one can consult the Ministry of Housing and Urban Planning, which maintains records of real property. ([sandsofwealth.com](https://sandsofwealth.com/blogs/news/oman-title-deed?utm_source=openai))

Regarding the company "ABU ILYAS TRADING LLC," it is based in Muscat, Oman, and operates in the support activities for mining and machinery equipment sectors. The key principal is listed as Sulaiman Thani Anai Al Harrasi. ([dnb.com](https://www.dnb.com/business-directory/company-profiles.abu_ilyas_trading_llc.3e580842cfe981369c1840de9b9d3950.html?utm_source=openai))

Given the commonality of the surname "Ilyas," it's important to note that "ABU ILYAS TRADING LLC" may not be directly associated with Aqib Ilyas or his family. Without specific information or access to private records, it is not possible to confirm any property ownership details related to Aqib Ilyas.

citations.title: Aqib Ilyas
Oman Law Blog: February 2009

task_12.query_used: Investigate YouTube and sports video platforms for match footage or interviews featuring Aqib Ilyas cricket
task_12.data:
Aqib Ilyas, the captain of the Oman national cricket team, has been featured in several match footages and interviews available on platforms like YouTube and ESPN.

**Match Footage:**

- **Sensational Catch Against Australia:** During the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024, Aqib Ilyas took a remarkable diving catch to dismiss Australia's Glenn Maxwell for a golden duck. This highlight is available on various sports video platforms. ([latestly.com](https://www.latestly.com/socially/sports/cricket/aqib-ilyas-takes-sensational-diving-catch-to-dismiss-glenn-maxwell-for-golden-duck-during-aus-vs-oma-icc-mens-t20-world-cup-2024-watch-video-6017050.html?utm_source=openai))

**Interviews:**

- **Post-Match Reflection:** In an interview with ESPN, Ilyas discussed his match-winning century that led Oman to a tense victory over the USA. ([espn.com](https://www.espn.com/video/clip/_/id/25295002?utm_source=openai))

- **Player Profile:** The International Cricket Council (ICC) featured Ilyas in a video titled "Get to know Oman's Aqib Ilyas," providing insights into his cricketing journey and personal experiences. ([icc-cricket.com](https://www.icc-cricket.com/videos/get-to-know-oman-s-aqib-ilyas-t20-world-cup?utm_source=openai))

These resources offer a comprehensive view of Aqib Ilyas's contributions to cricket, showcasing his on-field performances and personal reflections.

report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Aqib Ilyas

**Report Date:** June 11, 2025

### Executive Summary

Aqib Ilyas is the captain of the Oman national cricket team, a right-handed batsman, and right-arm off-spin bowler.  He has a notable international cricket career representing Oman, including participation in the 2024 T20 World Cup. No adverse information or red flags were discovered during this OSINT investigation.

### Thematic Summary of Key Findings

**Professional / Career Background**

* Professional cricketer representing the Oman national team.
* Captain of the Oman national cricket team as of 2024.
* Right-handed top-order batsman and right-arm off-spin bowler.
* T20 International debut on November 21, 2015, against Hong Kong.
* Played 32 One Day Internationals (ODIs), scoring 1,234 runs with an average of 44.07, including two centuries and nine fifties. Highest ODI score is 109*.
* Studied civil engineering in Dubai in 2010.

**Business & Financial Activity**

* No specific business or financial affiliations were identified within the provided sources beyond his professional cricket career.


**Legal or Criminal Mentions**

* No legal proceedings or criminal records were found related to Aqib Ilyas.

**Academic / Public Recognition**

* Degree in civil engineering from a university in Dubai.
* Featured in match footage and interviews on platforms like YouTube and ESPN, including coverage of a spectacular catch against Australia during the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024.
* Profiled by ICC and ESPNcricinfo.

**Online / Social Presence**

* Presence confirmed on ESPNcricinfo, ESPN video (interview), ICC website (video feature), and LatestLY (news article highlighting a catch).


**Other Notable Mentions**

* Born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, but moved to Oman at six months old and grew up in Muscat.
* His elder brother, Adnan Ilyas, also represented Oman in international cricket.

### Risk Profile

Based on the available information, Aqib Ilyas presents a low reputational risk.  He is a recognized athlete with a successful cricket career and no apparent negative history.

---

### Sources Used (10 Most Relevant - as provided)


All sources provided were utilized in generating this report.  No additional sources were consulted.

flagged_issues: Minor discrepancy: Report states 'Studied civil engineering in Dubai in 2010' but retrieval evidence indicates he 'moved to Dubai to pursue a degree in civil engineering' in 2010 (the study period would extend beyond just 2010)
Missing detail: The report doesn't mention his recovery from a benign tumor on his ankle bone in 2021, which required 18-month rehabilitation - a significant career event
Missing detail: Report doesn't mention that he made history as the first Omani cricketer to score an international century
Missing context: The family background detail that they moved to Oman when he was six months old could be clearer in the main findings

task_1.query_used: Search LinkedIn for Aqib Ilyas cricket professional profiles and current employment in Oman sports organizations
task_1.data:
Aqib Ilyas Sulehri, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a prominent cricketer representing the Oman national team. A right-handed top-order batsman and right-arm off-spin bowler, Ilyas has been a consistent performer since his T20 International debut against Hong Kong on November 21, 2015. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

In One Day Internationals (ODIs), Ilyas has played 32 matches, scoring 1,234 runs at an average of 44.07, including two centuries and nine fifties. His highest ODI score is an unbeaten 109. In T20 Internationals, he has accumulated 1,330 runs in 56 matches, averaging 27.70, with a top score of 90. As a bowler, he has taken 23 wickets in ODIs and 47 in T20Is. ([espncricinfo.com](https://www.espncricinfo.com/cricketers/aqib-ilyas-940593?utm_source=openai))

Ilyas made history by becoming the first Omani cricketer to score an international century, achieving an unbeaten 109 against Nepal in February 2020. He followed this with another century, scoring 105 against the United States in the same series. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

In May 2024, Ilyas was appointed captain of Oman's squad for the 2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

Regarding his current employment with Oman sports organizations, specific details are not readily available in the provided sources. For the most accurate and up-to-date information, it is recommended to consult official Oman Cricket communications or Aqib Ilyas's professional profiles on platforms like LinkedIn.

task_2.query_used: Query Oman Cricket Association official website and member directories for Aqib Ilyas
task_2.data:
Aqib Ilyas is a prominent cricketer for the Oman national team, serving as a right-handed top-order batsman and off-spin bowler. Born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, he moved to Oman at six months old and grew up in Muscat. His elder brother, Adnan Ilyas, also represented Oman in international cricket. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

Ilyas made his Twenty20 International (T20I) debut for Oman against Hong Kong on November 21, 2015. He has since been a key player, contributing significantly with both bat and ball. In May 2024, he was appointed captain of the Omani squad for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, replacing long-serving skipper Zeeshan Maqsood. ([omancricket.org](https://www.omancricket.org/ilyas-lead-oman-t20-world-cup-2024/?utm_source=openai))

Throughout his career, Ilyas has demonstrated resilience, notably overcoming a benign tumor on his ankle bone in 2021, which required an 18-month rehabilitation period. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai)) His leadership and all-round performance continue to be instrumental in Oman's cricketing achievements.

task_11.query_used: Search property ownership records in Oman real estate databases for assets under Aqib Ilyas
task_11.data:
Aqib Ilyas Sulehri, born on September 5, 1992, in Sialkot, Pakistan, is a prominent cricketer who has represented the Oman national team since 2015. He is a right-handed top-order batsman and off-spin bowler. His brother, Adnan Ilyas, has also played international cricket for Oman. The Ilyas family relocated to Oman when Aqib was six months old, and he grew up in Muscat. In 2010, he moved to Dubai to pursue a degree in civil engineering. After completing his studies, he returned to Oman to focus on his cricket career. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqib_Ilyas?utm_source=openai))

In Oman, property ownership is documented through a title deed known as "Mulkiya," maintained by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Planning. This document provides details about the property, including descriptions, ownership status, and any encumbrances. ([omanlawblog.curtis.com](https://omanlawblog.curtis.com/2009/02/?utm_source=openai))

To verify property ownership, one can consult the Ministry of Housing and Urban Planning, which maintains records of real property. ([sandsofwealth.com](https://sandsofwealth.com/blogs/news/oman-title-deed?utm_source=openai))

Regarding the company "ABU ILYAS TRADING LLC," it is based in Muscat, Oman, and operates in the support activities for mining and machinery equipment sectors. The key principal is listed as Sulaiman Thani Anai Al Harrasi. ([dnb.com](https://www.dnb.com/business-directory/company-profiles.abu_ilyas_trading_llc.3e580842cfe981369c1840de9b9d3950.html?utm_source=openai))

Given the commonality of the surname "Ilyas," it's important to note that "ABU ILYAS TRADING LLC" may not be directly associated with Aqib Ilyas or his family. Without specific information or access to private records, it is not possible to confirm any property ownership details related to Aqib Ilyas.

task_12.query_used: Investigate YouTube and sports video platforms for match footage or interviews featuring Aqib Ilyas cricket
task_12.data:
Aqib Ilyas, the captain of the Oman national cricket team, has been featured in several match footages and interviews available on platforms like YouTube and ESPN.

**Match Footage:**

- **Sensational Catch Against Australia:** During the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024, Aqib Ilyas took a remarkable diving catch to dismiss Australia's Glenn Maxwell for a golden duck. This highlight is available on various sports video platforms. ([latestly.com](https://www.latestly.com/socially/sports/cricket/aqib-ilyas-takes-sensational-diving-catch-to-dismiss-glenn-maxwell-for-golden-duck-during-aus-vs-oma-icc-mens-t20-world-cup-2024-watch-video-6017050.html?utm_source=openai))

**Interviews:**

- **Post-Match Reflection:** In an interview with ESPN, Ilyas discussed his match-winning century that led Oman to a tense victory over the USA. ([espn.com](https://www.espn.com/video/clip/_/id/25295002?utm_source=openai))

- **Player Profile:** The International Cricket Council (ICC) featured Ilyas in a video titled "Get to know Oman's Aqib Ilyas," providing insights into his cricketing journey and personal experiences. ([icc-cricket.com](https://www.icc-cricket.com/videos/get-to-know-oman-s-aqib-ilyas-t20-world-cup?utm_source=openai))

These resources offer a comprehensive view of Aqib Ilyas's contributions to cricket, showcasing his on-field performances and personal reflections.
